TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract RecurrencePattern

Docs.summary: Represents the pattern of incidence of recurring appointments and tasks for the associated and object.

remarks.para: Use the GetRecurrencePattern method to return the RecurrencePattern object associated with an AppointmentItem or TaskItem object.

Calling GetRecurrencePattern or ClearRecurrencePattern has the side effect of setting the IsRecurring property of the item accordingly. This property can be used as required for efficient filtering of the object.
The type of recurrence pattern is indicated by the property. The RecurrenceType property is the first property you should set.
The following properties are valid for all recurrence patterns: , , StartDate, , or Type.

The following table shows the properties that are valid for the different recurrence types. An error occurs if the item is saved and the property is null or contains an invalid value. Monthly and yearly patterns are only valid for a single day. Weekly patterns are only valid as the Or of the .

item.description: , Duration, EndTime, Interval, NoEndDate, Occurrences, PatternStartDate, PatternEndDate, StartTime
, Duration, EndTime, Interval, NoEndDate, Occurrences, PatternStartDate, PatternEndDate, StartTime
DayOfWeekMask, Duration, EndTime, Interval, , NoEndDate, Occurrences, PatternStartDate, PatternEndDate, StartTime
DayOfMonth, Duration, EndTime, Interval, , NoEndDate, Occurrences, PatternStartDate, PatternEndDate, StartTime
DayOfWeekMask, Duration, EndTime, Interval, Instance, NoEndDate, Occurrences, PatternStartDate, PatternEndDate, StartTime

remarks.para: When you work with recurring appointment items, you should release any prior references, obtain new references to the recurring appointment item before you access or modify the item, and release these references as soon as you are finished and have saved the changes. This practice applies to the recurring object, and any or object. To release a reference in Visual Basic, set that existing object to Nothing. In C#, explicitly release the memory for that object.

Note that even after you release your reference and attempt to obtain a new reference, if there is still an active reference, held by another add-in or Outlook, to one of the above objects, your new reference will still point to an out-of-date copy of the object. Therefore, it is important that you release your references as soon as you are finished with the recurring appointment.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the parent Outlook application for the object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Class As OlObjectClass

Docs.summary: Returns an constant indicating the object's class. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int DayOfMonth { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value indicating the day of the month on which the recurring appointment or task occurs. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlDaysOfWeek DayOfWeekMask { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlDaysOfWeek get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlDaysOfWeek value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant representing the mask for the days of the week on which the recurring appointment or task occurs. Read/write.

remarks.para: The DayOfWeekMask should be set after the property has been set and before the and properties are set.
Monthly and yearly patterns are only valid for a single day. Weekly patterns are only valid as the Or of the DayOfWeekMask.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Duration { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value indicating the duration (in minutes) of the . Read/write.

remarks.para: For recurrences, this property is only valid for appointments.
To create a duration of one day for an all-day event, set the duration equal to 1440.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime EndTime { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a DateTime indicating the end time for a recurrence pattern. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property is only valid for appointments.
When you create a object and no time zones have been specified for the appointment, and EndTime of the RecurrencePattern object are based on the time zone specified by .

If you want to create a recurring appointment for a particular time zone, you should first create an , set , and then call . The RecurrencePattern object returned will have both StartTime and EndTime based on the time zone specified by AppointmentItem.StartTimeZone. Note that in the Appointment Recurrence dialog box, the time indicated as Start is RecurrencePattern.StartTime which is based on AppointmentItem.StartTimeZone, but the time indicated as End is not always the same as RecurrencePattern.EndTime which is based on AppointmentItem.StartTimeZone; the displayed time value is based on .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Exceptions As Exceptions

Docs.summary: Returns the collection for a specified series of recurring appointments. Read-only.

remarks.para: When you work with recurring appointment items, you should release any prior references, obtain new references to the recurring appointment item before you access or modify the item, and release these references as soon as you are finished and have saved the changes. This practice applies to the recurring object, and any or object. To release a reference in Visual Basic, set that existing object to Nothing. In C#, explicitly release the memory for that object.

Note that even after you release your reference and attempt to obtain a new reference, if there is still an active reference, held by another add-in or Outlook, to one of the above objects, your new reference will still point to an out-of-date copy of the object. Therefore, it is important that you release your references as soon as you are finished with the recurring appointment.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Outlook.AppointmentItem GetOccurrence([in]valuetype System.DateTime StartDate) runtime managed
Public Function GetOccurrence (StartDate As DateTime) As AppointmentItem

Docs.param: A Date value that represents local time.
Docs.summary: Returns a specific instance of the object on the specified date.
Docs.returns: An AppointmentItem object that represents the specific appointment on the specified date.

remarks.para: Note: The GetOccurrence method generates an error if no appointment of that series exists on the specified date.

When you work with recurring appointment items, you should release any prior references, obtain new references to the recurring appointment item before you access or modify the item, and release these references as soon as you are finished and have saved the changes. This practice applies to the recurring object, and any or object. To release a reference in Visual Basic, set that existing object to Nothing. In C#, explicitly release the memory for that object.

Note that even after you release your reference and attempt to obtain a new reference, if there is still an active reference, held by another add-in or Outlook, to one of the above objects, your new reference will still point to an out-of-date copy of the object. Therefore, it is important that you release your references as soon as you are finished with the recurring appointment.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Instance { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value specifying the count for which the recurrence pattern is valid for a given interval. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property is only valid for recurrences of the olRecursMonthNth and olRecursYearNth type and allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the Nth occurrence, such as "the 2nd Sunday in March" pattern. The count is set numerically: 1 for the first, 2 for the second, and so on through 5 for the last. Values greater than 5 will generate errors when the pattern is saved.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Interval { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value specifying the number of units of a given recurrence type between occurrences. Read/write.

remarks.para: The Interval property must be set before setting .
For example, setting the Interval property to 2 and the property to olRecursWeekly would cause the pattern to occur every second week.

When RecurrenceType is set to olRecursYearNth or olRecursYear, the Interval property indicates the number of years between occurrences. For example, Interval equals 1 indicates the recurrence is every year, Interval equals 2 indicates the recurrence is every 2 years, and so on.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MonthOfYear { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value indicating which month of the year is valid for the specified recurrence pattern. Read/write.

remarks.para: The value can be a number from 1 through 12. For example, setting this property to 5 and the property to olRecursYearly would cause this recurrence pattern to occur every May. This property is only valid for recurrence patterns whose RecurrenceType property is set to olRecursYearly or olRecursYearNth.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool NoEndDate { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns a Boolean (bool in C#) value that indicates True if the recurrence pattern has no end date. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the NoEndDate property is False. If neither PatternEndDate nor Occurrences is set, the pattern is considered infinite and NoEndDate is True.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Occurrences { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value indicating the number of occurrences of the recurrence pattern. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property allows the definition of a recurrence pattern that is only valid for the specified number of subsequent occurrences. For example, you can set this property to 10 for a formal training course that will be held on the next ten Thursday evenings. This property must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If the property or the Occurrences property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite and the property is False. If neither PatternEndDate nor Occurrences is set, the pattern is considered infinite and NoEndDate is True.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the parent Object of the specified object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime PatternEndDate { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a DateTime indicating the end date for the recurrence pattern. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property is optional but must be coordinated with other properties when setting up a recurrence pattern. If this property or the property is set, the pattern is considered to be finite, and the property is False. If neither PatternEndDate nor Occurrences is set, the pattern is considered infinite and NoEndDate is True. The property must be set before setting PatternEndDate.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime PatternStartDate { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a DateTime indicating the start date for the recurrence pattern. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlRecurrenceType RecurrenceType { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlRecurrenceType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlRecurrenceType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant specifying the frequency of occurrences for the recurrence pattern. Read/write.

remarks.para: You must set the RecurrenceType property before you set other properties for a object. The RecurrencePattern properties that you can set subsequently depends on the value of RecurrenceType, as shown in the following table:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Regenerate { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns a Boolean (bool in C#) that indicates True if the task should be regenerated following this pass through the recurrence pattern. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property is used to control the regeneration of the task as each occurrence of a recurring task is completed. It is only valid for tasks. It is not valid for appointments.

To create a recurrence pattern, you must first set the property to set the frequency, then set the Regenerate property to True to regenerate the task. After setting Regenerate to True, do not set it to False. If you subsequently set Regenerate to False, then you should set up the recurrence pattern again by getting a new object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Session As NameSpace

Docs.summary: Returns the object for the current session. Read-only.

remarks.para: The Session property and the method can be used interchangeably to obtain the NameSpace object for the current session. Both members serve the same purpose. For example, the following pairs of statements perform the same function:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime StartTime { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a DateTime indicating the start time for a recurrence pattern. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property is only valid for appointments.
When you create a object and no time zones have been specified for the appointment, StartTime and of the RecurrencePattern object are based on the time zone specified by .

If you want to create a recurring appointment for a particular time zone, you should first create an , set , and then call . The RecurrencePattern object returned will have both StartTime and EndTime based on the time zone specified by AppointmentItem.StartTimeZone. Note that in the Appointment Recurrence dialog box, the time indicated as Start is RecurrencePattern.StartTime which is based on AppointmentItem.StartTimeZone, but the time indicated as End is not always the same as RecurrencePattern.EndTime which is based on AppointmentItem.StartTimeZone; the displayed time value is based on .
